translations.translation: He said, 'What do you think you were doing, Samiri?'
Moses asked: "O Sameri, what was the matter?"
Moses said: "What, then, is your case, O Samiri?"
Moses asked, "Samiri, what were your motives?"
Said Moosa, “And what is your explanation, O Samri?”
(Musa) said: "And what is the matter with you. O Samiri"
He said: What was then your object, O Samiri?
Moses said, 'And thou, Samaritan, what was thy business?'
(Moses) said: And what hast thou to say, O Samiri?
Moses said, "What was the matter with you, Samiri?"
Musa said: what was thy object, O Samiri?
He said, ‘What is your business, O Samiri?’
(Moses) said: "What then is thy case, O Samiri?"
[Musa (Moses)] said: "And what is the matter with you. O Samiri? (i.e. why did you do so?)"
You, Samaritan' said he (Moses), 'what was your business'
He said, “What do you have to say, O Samarian?”
[Moses] said, "And what is your case, O Samiri?"
[20:95] He said, ‘And what have you to say, what was the motive for [doing] what you did, O Samaritan?’
Then Moses went to al-Samiri, and he (said: And what hast thou to say, Samiri?) What drove you to worship the calf, Samiri?

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text:
وقوله تعالى: { فَمَا خَطْبُكَ يٰسَامِرِيُّ } يعني ما أمْرُكَ
 وقال: إنَّ السَّامري كَان من أَهل كَرْمَانَ

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: فلما سمع موسى عذره، ندم على فعله، فرجع إلى معاتبة من يضلهم و { قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكَ } أي: أي شيء هو أعظم مقصودك من هذه التفرقة والإضلال { يٰسَامِرِيُّ } [طه: 95] المضل
